image.altText: A concrete building with lettering above the entrance reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory".

props.synopsis: Nicholas Kozac pleaded guilty to possessing a trafficable amount of cocaine after he was caught with nearly 100 grams of cocaine.

title.children: Cocaine-dealing used car salesman warned to 'keep nose clean'

image.altText: The exterior of a concrete building with the words "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory" over the entry.

props.synopsis: Chief Justice Lucy McCallum says Rick McGary has not accepted blame for the rapes, which occurred in Canberra in 2020 and 2016.

title.children: 'No remorse': Former ANU academic jailed for six years for raping two people

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair in a paramedic uniform sits on a couch holding a baby in her arms.

props.synopsis: Rachel Szigeti was preparing to leave for the hospital to give birth to her second baby when she realised the moment had suddenly arrived. That was when her husband Cedric sprang into action and called paramedics.

title.children: Paramedics don't usually get to 'catch a baby', but this crew did

image.altText: A man stares down the barrel of a camera while sitting in a room, wearing all black.

props.synopsis: The man who stabbed two Australian National University students in 2023 is given a nominated sentence of life to be carried out in a secure mental health facility.

title.children: ANU stabber 'may never be safe for release into the community'

image.altText: A man in sunglasses speaking to media.

props.synopsis: Shakira Adams had no licence and methamphetamine in her system when she drove a stolen car at least 177 kilometres per hour into Matthew McLuckie's car.

title.children: Tom's son was killed in a horror crash. Today the driver got the maximum penalty

image.altText: An office building, with a sign that reads 'ACT Government'.

props.synopsis: A legislative inquiry has criticised the ACT government for aggressively recovering debts from people it found were ineligible for stamp duty concessions.

title.children: Home buyers hit by harsh debt pursuit, inquiry finds

image.altText: CSIRO sign generic

props.synopsis: Just a month after announcing 350 job cuts, the CSIRO has received a funding boost, but proposed job cuts will still happen, the national science agency says.

title.children: CSIRO receives $233m funding boost but up to 350 jobs still to go

image.altText: A man with white hair receives a massage from a woman standing next to him while he attaches a watch to the wrist of another

props.synopsis: US Democrats continue their drip-feed of material from sex predator Jeffrey Epstein’s estate, releasing more photos on the eve of a deadline for the full publication of the Epstein files.

title.children: More photos released on eve of Epstein files deadline

image.altText: A small plane being pulled from water.

props.synopsis: The crashworthiness of a seaplane that plunged into the ocean off Rottnest island in January, killing three people on board, becomes a key focus of an investigation by Australia's transport safety watchdog.

title.children: Breaking: Fatal Rottnest crash probe questions plane's safety system, pilot's judgement

image.altText: ANZ logo

props.synopsis: The Federal Court has increased penalties to be paid by ANZ to $250 million, while the ASX rises after strong gains on Wall Street overnight. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: ANZ to pay $250m penalty, ASX rises after Wall St rally

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ANZ shares up despite record fine
Federal Court orders ANZ to pay $250 million for misconduct

image.altText: Tahli Gill and Dean Hewitt curl

props.synopsis: Australia's mixed curling team of Tahli Gill and Dean Hewitt have fallen just short of qualifying for the 2026 Winter Olympic Games.

title.children: Heartbreak as Aussie curlers miss Olympic qualifying

image.altText: A soldier crouches down near the back of a tank. The soldier's back is to the camera.

props.synopsis: The ABC is granted exclusive access to the ADF operation to transport M1A1 Abrams tanks to Ukraine, via Poland, which included an ocean voyage of more than 50 days.

title.children: 'Better than anything Russia has got': Australian tanks arrive in Ukraine

image.altText: An illustration of a woman in work outfit popping out of a phone screen with farm in the background.

props.synopsis: Influencers push a false promise of easy money and a better life in Australia with a Work and Holiday Visa, inspiring young Indonesians to take extreme measures to chase an almost unrealisable dream.

title.children: Dream life in Australia sold by influencers doesn't match reality

image.altText: Gun buyback 1996 Port Arthur

props.synopsis: Days after the Bondi terror attack, the federal government has announced a new national buyback scheme.

title.children: Here's what we know about the new gun buyback scheme

image.altText: A close up of Jactina Allan speaking at a media event.

props.synopsis: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan has apologised after her husband was caught drink driving, saying the incident left her "disappointed and embarrassed".

title.children: Victorian premier's husband caught drink driving

image.altText: The front of The Kennedy Center - a large rectangular grey building with the name written in black across the top.

props.synopsis: The venue, named after former US president John F Kennedy, is to be renamed the Trump Kennedy Center after a vote by its board — which Mr Trump himself hand-picked this year.

title.children: Trump's hand-picked board renames arts centre as Trump Kennedy Center

image.altText: A man in nautical outfit stands before a large ship amid ropes and a large group of people

props.synopsis: Master and Commander flopped in 2003 but is now hailed as a masterpiece. Discover why this epic is earning renewed respect.

title.children: 'Gladiator goes to sea': Russell Crowe on Master and Commander

image.altText: A mum and daughter smiling

props.synopsis: The Small Business and Family Enterprise Ombudsman says he's seen a rise in small businesses disputes with digital platforms.

title.children: Child abuse falsely detected in bakery's social media

image.altText: Airbnb prices for locations on map of Hobart

props.synopsis: The tourism industry remains opposed to a 5 per cent levy on short-stay accommodation that the Tasmanian government has promised to implement.

title.children: Tasmania's proposed short-stay levy 'unjust', tourism industry argues

image.altText: Mum and dad with two teenagers, two young children, standing in front of home with water tank, green grass

props.synopsis: The Ballini family made the move to regional Queensland where they are are paying half the mortgage they were in the south-east, but that's rapidly changing.

title.children: Family cuts weekly mortgage payment to $330 with rural move

image.altText: Dayna Isaac

props.synopsis: A judge labelled intimate partner violence "a scourge in a civilised society" when he sentenced Paul Sultana to 44 years in jail for the murder of Dayna Isaac.

title.children: Paul Sultana sentenced to 44 years in prison for murdering Dayna Isaac

image.altText: The Neo robot

props.synopsis: Humanoid robots may be part of our future, but human psychology and the uncanny valley may stand between them and world domination.

title.children: This robot is designed to do your chores, but would you trust it?

image.altText: A police vehicle parked in front of a house with a grey tin roof, white weatherboard and white fencing.

props.synopsis: Jodie Hill wept as a Supreme Court jury found her not guilty of murder and manslaughter, follow a week of deliberations.

title.children: Regional Victorian found not guilty of murder walks free despite jail cell admission

image.altText: Shelves of alcohol inside a bottle shop.

props.synopsis: A major study into alcohol policy in the NT has recommended tightening bottle shop trading hours, raising the minimum price of alcohol and reforming the approach to individual liquor bans in the territory.

title.children: Expert disagrees with political argument against minimum prices for alcohol

image.altText: Prince William, Princess Catherine and their children, George, Charlotte and Louis, sit in a field and smile

props.synopsis: The Prince and Princess of Wales have released a new family portrait to coincide with their annual Christmas card.

title.children: Prince William and Princess Catherine release 2025 Christmas card

image.altText: An aerial view of Ashley Youth Detention Centre.

props.synopsis: Police say five of the seven youths who escaped the Ashley Youth Detention Centre last night are now back in custody. One staff member was stabbed during the breakout.

title.children: Fifth detainee caught after violent Tasmanian detention centre breakout

image.altText: Jake Paul looks up at Anthony Joshua

props.synopsis: Jake Paul vs Anthony Joshua is not the first sham fight, neither will it be the last. But there is a real risk that, one way or another, it will have a lasting impact. Here's everything you need to know about the contest.

title.children: Everything you need to know about the Jake Paul and Anthony Joshua fight

image.altText: A graphic featuring a woman with blonde hair, a sign for Philosopher Falls, a fern and a faint map.

props.synopsis: More than two years after Belgian backpacker Celine Cremer vanished near Philosopher Falls, new discoveries have helped investigators better understand her final movements — though many questions still remain.

title.children: 'We've changed our theory': What recent discoveries say about Celine's last location

image.altText: A man and a woman stand on the alfresco of their incompete home.

props.synopsis: Almost two years after the slab went down, Jo and David Dimov's "forever home" is still unfinished. The couple is part of a class action that has "snowballed" against a major WA builder.

title.children: Home owners could claim millions if class action against builder succeeds

image.altText: Two gold Chinese dragon heads as the head of a boat on a river.

props.synopsis: Braving 4am starts, the dragon boat team of The University of Philippines is full of dedicated athletes. But without being recognised as an official sport, they receive no pay for their time and sacrifice.

title.children: These dragon boat athletes are unpaid, but driven by community pride

image.altText: A close-up of a politician's face as he speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: The Queensland government says it made the decision after considering a 530-page independent review into the evidence surrounding the treatments.

title.children: Queensland pause on puberty blockers for trans adolescents to continue

image.altText: A man with short buzzed red hair wears dark grey-blue surgical scrubs while sitting in front of a laptop at a desk in an office.

props.synopsis: Doctor Greg Malham, who was terminated from a Melbourne private hospital following an ABC investigation into his behaviour, will have to undertake mentoring sessions to continue practising.

title.children: Practice conditions put on neurosurgeon after behaviour complaints

image.altText: Sophie Bruce sitting on a deck lying back on a swag holding a puppy in her lap.

props.synopsis: The idea of life out on the edge of the desert has pulled in young people from across the country and overseas.

title.children: Life on a remote cattle station where 'people leave a little bit better'
